Electrical Engineering Student

Enthusiastic. Motivated. Self-Learner.

I have completed Academic Term 4 of Electrical Engineering at Memorial University of Newfoundland. My interests lie mainly in Aerospace and Hi-Tech. I have professional experience in embedded systems, research, and system planning. This website showcases my skills, and provides an inside look at who I am.

Work Experience

I have been employed in many positions throughout my education.

  • + Materials Team Co-op (Avalon Holographics)
  • + Soft Matter Research Student (MUN)
  • + System Planning Engineering Co-op (Newfoundland Power)
  • + Optics and Photonics Reseach Student (MUN)
  • + Software Engineering Co-op (Curtiss-Wright)

Across these positions I have gained a wealth of professional experience, and developed many skills.

Projects

I love what I do. Electrical Engineering is not only my field of study, but also my passion. I spend a large amount of my free time learning new things and trying out projects of my own. Some of the things I have taught myself are:

  • + Arduino and Raspberry Pi
  • + SolidWorks, AutoCAD and 3D Studio Max
  • + Xcode and Qt
  • + Unity 3D
  • + Drone Project

Extra-Curricular

I have been heavily involved in extra-curricular activities throughout my entire life. My endeavours have spanned sports, academic teams, and community service, musical theatre, and more. Each activity has been a team activity

  • + IEEE MUN Student Chapter
  • + Easter Seals NL
  • + MUN Engineering Society 'A'
  • + MUN Students Union

Follow a link to learn more about each activity.
